## âš™ï¸ Section 1: **Trigger & Data Fetching**

This section is responsible for **automatically starting the workflow** and **retrieving Fiverr gig listings** for UGC content creators.

---

### â° 1. `Daily Fiverr Scrape Trigger`

> **ğŸ§  Purpose:** Starts the entire workflow on a scheduled basis.

ğŸ“Œ **Details:**

* ğŸ” Runs automatically at specified intervals (daily, hourly, etc.)
* ğŸ”Œ Acts as the starting point of your automation pipeline
* ğŸ§© Useful for keeping your dataset fresh without manual intervention

ğŸ”§ **Example configuration:**

* `Frequency:` Every 24 hours
* `Time:` 09:00 AM UTC

---

### ğŸŒ 2. `Fetch Fiverr Search Results`

> **ğŸ§  Purpose:** Makes an HTTP GET request to Fiverr to fetch search results for UGC content creators.

ğŸ“Œ **Details:**

* ğŸŒ **Endpoint:** `https://www.fiverr.com/search/gigs?query=UGC%20content%20creator`
* ğŸ§¾ **Method:** `GET`
* ğŸ“¦ **Returns:** Raw HTML content of the search result page
* ğŸ” Supports headers (e.g., user-agent) if needed to bypass scraping blocks

ğŸ§° **Pro tips:**

* Consider rotating user agents or using proxies for better reliability
* Use query parameters to refine your search (e.g., country, category)

---

## ğŸ§  Section 2: **HTML Parsing & Data Logging**

This section focuses on **extracting useful data** from the raw HTML and then **storing it securely** in Google Sheets for future reference.

---

### ğŸ§± 3. `Extract Gig Data from HTML`

> **ğŸ§  Purpose:** Parses the fetched HTML and extracts key gig details.

ğŸ“Œ **Extracted Fields:**

* ğŸ’µ **Price** â€“ Starting price of the gig
* ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨ **Seller** â€“ Name of the gig creator
* ğŸ“ **Title** â€“ Gig headline
* ğŸ”— **Gig URL** â€“ Direct link to the gig

ğŸ” **How it works:**

* Uses **CSS selectors** or **XPath** to find the right HTML nodes
* Grabs the values and passes them as structured data to the next node

âš ï¸ **Note:** You may need to update selectors if Fiverr changes its HTML structure.

---

### ğŸ“Š 4. `Append Gig Data to Sheet`

> **ğŸ§  Purpose:** Stores the extracted gig data in a connected Google Sheet.

ğŸ“Œ **Details:**

* ğŸ“ Appends each gig as a new row
* ğŸ§¾ Keeps a log of all scrapes for historical analysis
* ğŸ”„ Works with dynamic ranges â€“ no manual sheet setup needed

ğŸ” **Sheet Features:**

* ğŸ§¹ You can apply filters or conditional formatting
* ğŸ—‚ Consider using a timestamp column for easier tracking

---

## âœ… Summary

Your workflow is a **powerful automation** that:

* ğŸ”„ Runs automatically on schedule
* ğŸŒ Fetches Fiverr UGC gigs
* ğŸ§± Parses and extracts valuable info
* ğŸ“Š Logs everything in an easy-to-analyze Google Sheet

Let me know if you'd like help adding:

* ğŸ”” Email/Slack alerts when new gigs are found
